noun.description: A long, narrow part or section forming the handle of a tool or club, the body of a spear or arrow, or a similar implement.
examples: the shaft of a golf club

noun.description: A ray of light or bolt of lightning.
A long, narrow, typically vertical hole that gives access to a mine, accommodates an elevator in a building, or provides ventilation.

examples: brilliant sunshine shafted through the skylight

verb.description: (of a man) have sexual intercourse with (a woman).

origin: Old English sc√¶ft, sceaft handle, pole, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schaft, German Schaft, and perhaps also to scepter. Early senses of the verb ( late Middle English) were fit with a handle and send out shafts of light.
